body.description: 10th Gen Intel Core i7-10700 desktop processor. Features Intel Turbo Boost Max Technology 3.0. Built for the everyday desktop user; this processor delivers amazing performance for everything from enthusiast gaming and creation to productivity. Cooler included in the box. ONLY compatible with 400 series chipset based motherboard. 65W.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 955 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great CPU! And about the "tampering"...
reviews.reviewText: Just installed my i7-10700 in a Gigabyte Z490 Aorus Elite and paired with 32GB Corsair Vengeance LPX (2666) with zero issues. Great performance bump over my previous i7-6700, running at similar temps as well. Idles around 28-32C and HeavyLoad stress test bumps it up to 66-68C using a BeQuiet Pure Rock Slim, Arctic Cooling MX-4, and the motherboard's "silent" fan curve for the CPU.If you're a stock cooler user that still cares about aesthetics, good news! The stock cooler with the i7-10700 is blacked out, has a sleeved fan cable, and has a copper slug.At the moment, the other reviews imply that they got a tampered product. That may very well be since I can't actually hold their product and verify for myself, but I'll offer an alternative view on this-- The sticker on my box looked exactly like these others' pictures, and I'm 100% sure it was not physically tampered with upon close inspection. In fact, this sticker does NOT even appear to be the multi-layer type of tamper-evident stickers. When I tried to peel the sticker in various ways, all it ever did was tear the underlying paper/cardboard along with it. It seems like this was merely a case of the "factory sealed" lettering not being uniformly printed onto the sticker, or possibly even rubbed off of the exterior, and nothing more. (A gentle fingernail scrape wiped away the letters easily for me)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than my i3

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not just for gaming!
reviews.reviewText: This cpu was bought for an all around use set-up. Cannot complain. Integrated graphics are doing everything I need until gpu's become less scarce and more affordable. UPdate: Did purchase a workstation video card for now and this system is working beautifully. Doing everything I throw at it, so far. I do have a higher core/ thread count chip for more intensive projects, but not what this one was built for...Cannot complain.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not tampered with
reviews.reviewText: Many reviews mention they received a tampered with box. The Made in Vietnam version of this cpu arrives in a box that has it's tamper seal printed backwards -- meaning the paint that is supposed to come off when you rip open the seal is printed on the outside of the seal, so the paint wears out from rubbing against other boxes in shipment and against shipping material, which makes it appear that the box was opened. It however was not and the cpu is brand new. I purchase multiple Intel chips and I noticed this right away after reading the reviews and receiving my cpu with a rubbed out seal too -- if you use your nail you can see that the paint will come right off -- however if you open the seal it will not stay on the box since it is printed on the outside of the seal. Hence, the CPUs are not tampered with, just an issue with how they created those seals. As to the misalignment of the cpu in the box -- this is something that almost always happens in Intel cpus and is not something to be wary of. The CPU i received performs top notch on a z490 motherboard, with 4889 R20 score.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good all around processor
reviews.reviewText: I think this processor is the unsung hero of the entire 10th gen product launch. It has a slightly lower TDP, so it is not a furnace in the case like some of the other 10th gen processors (I'm using a dual tower air cooler without issues). With a little bios adjustment and a Z series motherboard, you can adjust the BCLK slightly higher and extend the turbo boosting to get 97% of a regular unlocked "K" CPU at a significantly lower price. I use it with DDR4 3600 memory, and I'd be hard pressed to notice a difference between my old 9900k and this CPU in regular usage.If you want to spend an extra $100-200 for that last 3-5% of performance that you'd get out of an unlocked 10700k or 10900k, so be it, but this is a good alternative for the budget conscious Intel fan looking for higher end performance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Needs a better cooler.
reviews.reviewText: I decided to base my new DAW on this processor and I'm glad I did. Using Cubase 10.5 I am only seeing about 25% of the processor being used at any given time. I don't intend to use this computer for anything else but it is imperative that it be quiet.I used the Intel supplied cooler for a couple of days but in benchmarking the processor got up to 100C (212F!). That's crazy hot. That was WITH thermal throttling.I replaced the wimpy cooler with a 150W TDP one. Telling BIOS that you installed a tower cooler (automatically) raises the TDP to 125W. No more throttling and never gets above 60C. (Pretty amazing for a $25 cooler I think.). The fan is inaudible from a foot away.Rendering my projects now takes mere seconds rather than minutes. I like that. But my basic reason for building a new computer was reliability. I was using a 10 year old HP desktop.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2020
reviews.reviewText: This was a upgrade from my 7th gen!! Oh boy this was a great jump from just the 7th gen i7, very happy with the performance. It runs very cool ( I am running a liquid cooler however) but have not needed to overclock yet! ;)I did want to comment on the shipping. It was received it additional cushioning and all seals we’re intact.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product! But beware of Greedy sellers and the price gauging.
reviews.reviewText: Listen I was desperate enough to buy this CPU at a 40 dollar markup because everything else was sold out, I hate greedy businesses. That being said, I'm in love with it. Great cpu for gaming paired it with a z490 asus prime A, and a 2080 super! I'm flying. Most coolers that worked with previous gen will work with this 10th gen.My product was sold by a 3rd party via Amazon, I checked the box and everything was factory sealed and delivered perfectly. The 40 bucks extra i spent... i guess.
Works like a charm after upgrading my Acer PC
Muy bueno 8 núcleos 16 hilos trabajando con mi sistema de enfriamiento a 45-50 grados centígrados, con juegos como cyberpunk 2077 se eleva a los 65 grados centígrados,apoyandose más en la grafica.
Processore trovato per caso . Da un anno l'ho uso e per ora e perfetto . Uso sul PC gaming .

reviews.reviewTitle: Gut, Lüfter kann man sich sparen
reviews.reviewText: Gut verpackt. Den Lüfter kann man sich sparen. Jeder baut heutzutage einen besseren ein. Gut falls man noch keinen hat.
